TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
69·
SEue dawe&slong; aren þat men callez·
þe &slong;onenda&ydot; Sonenda&ydot; is be&slong;t of alle·
þanne aungle&slong; habbuz heore ple&ydot;·
Alle þe &slong;unfole &slong;oulez wicke·
þat beoz in helle pine&slong; þicke·
Hu&ydot; re&slong;tez ⁁hem
⁁ þat ilke da&ydot;·
¶þe &slong;torie is a&slong;e ich eou radde·
Hou &slong;eint Miȝhel
powel Powel ladde·
To þe pe&ydot;ne&slong; of helle·
He &slong;aiȝh at helle ȝate&slong; &slong;tonde·
Galutre&slong; al fu&ydot;&rrot;ie to fonde·
Sunfole &slong;oule&slong; to quelle·
¶Some bi þe fiet weren an hongue·
And &slong;ome bi heo&rrot;e tre&slong;&slong;es longue·
Heo&rrot;e pe&ydot;nes fo&rrot;to lienge·
Some bi hondene and bi armes·
And some bi heo&rrot;e erene and bi þe þarmes·
And some bi heo&rrot;e toungues hienge·
Powel lokede him bi&slong;ide
And &slong;aiȝh a flod in helle glide
þareinne weren be&slong;te&slong; felle·
Some a&slong;e fi&slong;che&slong; in þe se·
And &slong;ome a&slong;e wo&rrot;me&slong; fierden heo·
Sunfole &slong;oule&slong; to quelle·
A ful heiȝh b&rrot;ugge and vnguod·
Wa&slong; maked ouer þat foule flod·
To habbe redie pa&slong;&slong;age·
To laten þe guode &slong;oule&slong; pa&slong;e·
To seon oure louerde&slong; g&rabar;ce grace ·
Withoute ani outrage rage ·
69·
He &slong;aiȝh pe&ydot;ne&slong; fale and wicke
And &slong;unfole go&slong;tus þaron þicke·
Fo&rrot;&slong;oþe ieh eov &slong;egge·
þat bindez þe w&rrot;echche &slong;oule&slong; fa&slong;te·
And inte helle pine hem ca&slong;tez·
Heo&rrot;e &slong;unne&slong; fo&rrot;to abugge·
¶Nis no toungue þat al ma&ydot; telle·
Of þe &slong;trongue pe&ydot;ne&slong; of helle·
Ne þe pe&ydot;ne&slong; þat &slong;ome haue·
Lechours bi heom&slong;ulue wonen·
And wu&combmacr;men wummen þat of ho&rrot;e dom conne·
God amendi heo&rrot;e fare·
¶Powel opon þe b&rrot;ugge &slong;tod·
And lokede into þat foule flod·
He &slong;aiȝh heo&rrot;e diuer&slong;e pe&ydot;nes·
Some to heo&rrot;e kneos woden·
And &slong;ome to ho&rrot;e nauele&slong; &slong;toden·
And &slong;ome to heo&rrot;e e&ydot;ȝen·
¶Some to heo&rrot;e b&rrot;ouwes &slong;toden þ&combtildevert;in þerin ·
And &slong;ome to þe mouþe&slong; also &slong;w&ydot;n·
And &slong;ome to heo&rrot;e ch&ydot;nne·
þe &slong;unfole weren al wode·
So weren þei d&rrot;einte in þat flode·
Fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e dedlich &slong;unne·
¶Powel g&rabar;dde gradde and &slong;eide alas.The first "d" in "gradde" may have been an "o", in which case the word was probably "gode" before the abbreviation marker was added. Compare line 91, which is very similar, but the first "d" has a short ascender.
þat &slong;wuch &slong;o&rrot;uwe imaked wa&slong;·
Al þus powel Powel &slong;eide·
þulke þat to here naueles &slong;tondez
Lechour&slong; hu&ydot; weren in heo&rrot;e londe·
And in helle heo&rrot;e i&slong; a le&ydot;d.The singular form "is" seems erroneous.
¶þulke þat &slong;tondez to þe chinne·
In churche nolden hu&ydot; neu&combtildevert;e neuere ablinne
To Iaungli iaungli ne to chide·
Ne miȝte no p&rrot;echour &slong;o heom lere·
Of gode&slong; Godes wo&rrot;de&slong; fo&rrot;to heo&rrot;e·
þarefo&rrot;e in helle þei moten abide·
¶þulke þat &slong;tondez to heo&rrot;e b&rrot;owes·
Ad&rrot;onken a&slong;e it were &slong;ouwe&slong;·
In þat foule flod
Heo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e io&ydot;e wa&slong; mo&rrot;e to &slong;eon and heo&rrot;e·
Of þeire ne&ydot;ȝhebo&rrot;e&slong; teone·
þane of heo&rrot;e oþur guod·
¶Powel &slong;aiȝh an old man al one·
In one hu&ydot;&rrot;ne &slong;itte and grone·
And make reulich chere·
Feondes&slong; in is necke he bar·
Fo&rrot; he nolde nouȝht beo war·
þe ȝwile he wa&slong; here·
¶þanne &slong;eide powel Powel þo·
Ȝwat is þat man þat i&slong; &slong;o wo·
And in &slong;o gret trauaile·
þe Aungel aungel
Answere answere him aȝein
Powel fo&rrot;&slong;oþe ichulle þe &slong;eien
Withouten ani fa&ydot;le·
¶He wa&slong; an hokerere in is liue·
In wo&rrot;d in weo&rrot;k he dude G&ydot;le g&ydot;le ·
In þouȝt and eke dede·
Trichour he wa&slong; euere embe ȝwile
Foul nig and hard in al is liue·
þarefo&rrot;e he hath þere is mede·
¶Powel g&rabar;dde gradde and &slong;eide alas·
þat þulke &slong;oule imaked wa&slong;·
To pini &slong;o in wowe·
He lokede him bi&slong;ide þo·
A put he &slong;aiȝh wa&slong; ul of wo·
Hit wa&slong; þe feondes owe·
¶Sunfole &slong;oule&slong; fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e gult·
Weren in þat þu&slong;tur put ipult·
Heo&rrot;e tongue&slong; fo&rrot;to hete·
þulke weren bacbitare&slong; in heo&rrot;e liue·
þat no merci nadden &slong;iþe·
Powel bi gan to weope·
¶Powel weop fo&rrot; &slong;o&rrot;uwe þat he hadde·
þe Aungel aungel him a boure ladde
And bad him late al beo·
Wel mo pe&ydot;ne&slong; þane þou &slong;e⁁iȝewe.It seems clear that the scribe intended to emend "sewe" to "seiȝe", but this spoils the rh&ydot;me with "schewe" in the following line.
I &slong;chal þe ȝu&ydot;t in helle &slong;chewe·
Powel þat þou &slong;chalt i&slong;eo·
¶He let him &slong;eon a put bi cas·
þat with &slong;eouen &slong;eles a &slong;eled wa&slong;·
þat gan foole &slong;tinke·
He b&rrot;ac þe &slong;ele&slong; euerechon·
Foulere &slong;tunch na&slong; neuere non·
þane cam out of þane b&rrot;inke·
¶Al&slong;o þo dominical it tellez·
Hit is þe me&slong;te pine of helle·
Powel bereth witne&slong;&slong;e·
þe &slong;oule&slong; þat comez in þat p&combtildevert;&slong;oun prisoun ·
Of heom ni&slong; no mencion·
Noþer mo&rrot;e ne le&slong;&slong;e·
69· 200
Al&slong;o deop is þat fundement·
A&slong;e it is to þe firmament·
Heo&rrot;e gredingue farth a&slong;e þonder
Euerech feond on oþur &slong;at·
Much feo&rrot;lich him þouȝhte þat·
Powel hadde gret wunder·
¶In þat &slong;tinkinde put þei wone·
þulke þat ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
Marie &slong;one·
Nolden on bi leue·
He&ydot; hadden c&combtildevert;&slong;tindom Cristindom to ȝift·
And ȝif hu&ydot; wolden boþe ho&slong;el and &slong;ch&rrot;ift·
And &slong;ethþ⁁e wolden mi&slong;bileue·
¶Powel &slong;aiȝh a fu&ydot;&rrot; glowe g&combtildevert;mme grimme ·
Of &slong;eue colours wa&slong; þat leiȝe þarinne·
At &slong;euen hole&slong; hit out wende·
Sunfole &slong;oule&slong; weren þarinne·
Fo&rrot; hu&ydot; deiden in dedlich &slong;unne·
Heo&rrot;e &slong;unne&slong; fo&rrot;te amende·
¶þat o le&ydot;ȝe wa&slong; pu&ydot; pu&ydot;r &slong;nouȝh ȝw&ydot;ȝht·
þat oþer a&slong;e ha&ydot;l þat l&ydot;ȝt in d&ydot;ȝt Horstmann wonders whether "dyȝht" should be read "dyȝh".
þat þ&rrot;idde a&slong;e fu&ydot;&rrot; him b&rrot;ennez·
þat feo&rrot;þe wa&slong; hewene ich wene·
þat fiȝfte a&slong;e nadd&rrot;e&slong; on to &slong;eone·
þare wa&slong; lu&ydot;te wunne·
¶þe &slong;ixte le&ydot;ȝe ful cold wa&slong;·
þe &slong;eouenþe &slong;tonke foule alas·
þe &slong;oule&slong; weren þareinne·
Fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e &slong;unne&slong; no penau&combmacr;ce penaunce ·
Hu&ydot; nolden don no cheui&slong;aunce·
Ne neuere wickehede ablinne·
¶Powel lokede bi&slong;ide heom·
þare he &slong;aiȝh blake wu&combmacr;men wummen
And blake weren heo&rrot;e cloþu&slong;·
þe cloþu&slong; þat hu&ydot; hadden on·
Welden in pich and in b&rrot;um&slong;ton·
With d&rrot;agone&slong; and fu&ydot;&rrot; boþe·
¶Dragone&slong; weren aboute heo&rrot;e hal&slong;·
And &slong;eouen feonde&slong; þat weren fals·
þat da&ydot; þat hu&ydot; weren take·
þe feonde&slong; harden hadden ho&rrot;ne&slong; grete·
Hu&ydot; pulten heom fo&rrot; heo&rrot;e mi&slong;dede·
Muche wo þare hu&ydot; maden·
¶Some b&rrot;enden in þat fu&ydot;&rrot; þere·
And &slong;ome maden reulich bere·
And &slong;eiden in heo&rrot;e mone·
Some &slong;onguen in heo&rrot;e &slong;ongue·
Alas þat we liuen þus longue·
In hellefu&ydot;&rrot;e to grone·
¶þulke weren wnmmen in heo&rrot;e liue
þat bi fo&rrot;e heo&rrot;e wedlok and eke &slong;iþen·
Heo&rrot;e so&rrot;e child&rrot;en aslowe·
Ne &slong;ethþe hu&ydot; nolden atþe la&slong;te·
heo&rrot;e &slong;unne&slong; o da&ydot; fa&slong;te·
Ne to Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist abouwe·
¶Powel lokede up an heiȝh·
And &slong;aiȝh ane &slong;oule þare heo fleiȝh·
Among feondes &slong;eouene·
þat bodi was ded þat ilke da&ydot;·
þe &slong;oule þouȝthte to &slong;capen awe&ydot;·
And a &slong;capede alme&slong;t to heouene·
¶þo cam an Aungle aungle him aȝein·
And bad him laten is fleoingue beon·
And bileue with is make·
Of alle his &slong;unne&slong; a chartre hu&ydot; radde·
þe feonde&slong; out heo&rrot;e arme&slong; &slong;p&rrot;adden·
þat &slong;oule hu&ydot; gonne take·
¶þat wrechche &slong;oule hu&ydot; bounden fa&slong;te·
A feond in his necke hire ca&slong;te·
And bar hire into helle·
He &slong;te hire into þe put.Horstmann places "(!)" between "ste" and "hire".
Al&slong;o deope a&slong;e an&ydot; feond &slong;it·
His p&rrot;u&ydot;de hu&ydot; maden doun falle·
¶In one &slong;tude þare powel Powel &slong;tod·
He &slong;aiȝh a &slong;oule þat wa&slong; guod·
Toward heouene b&rrot;ingue·
A þou&slong;end Aungles aungles in a pla&ydot;·
Bifo&rrot;e þat &slong;oule hu&ydot; comen þadt da&ydot;·
And murie hu&ydot; gonne &slong;ingue·
¶To þat &slong;oule þanne &slong;eiden heo·
Sweting ible&slong;ed mote þou beo·
Euere withouten ende·
Nime we hu&ydot; &slong;eiden þis &slong;oule b&rrot;iȝht·
And beren to ih&combcurl;u Ihesu oure d&rrot;iȝht·
To o&rrot;e louerd þat is &slong;o hende·
¶þe &slong;oules þat weren in pining &slong;tude·
To &slong;eint Miȝhel hu&ydot; maden heo&rrot;e bede·
And to powel Powel boþe·
þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden heo&rrot;e erinde c&rabar;ue craue
Some remedie fo&rrot; to haue·
þei it were heom loth·
¶þat heo&rrot;de powel Powel aud &slong;eint Miȝhel·
On kneo&slong; hu&ydot; fullen to grounde echdel·
And Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist bi&slong;ouȝhten
A þou&slong;end Aungele&slong; aungles fullen heom with
Alle hu&ydot; mauden heom pa&ydot;&slong; and grith
To Ie&slong;u þat hem bouȝhte·
¶He ȝaf heom remedie with oute &slong;o&rrot;uwe·
Fram saturda&ydot; Saturda&ydot; non to þe monenmo&rrot;uwe Monenmoruwe ·
Fo&rrot; to beon on bounde·
He þat v&slong;cher wa&slong; in helle·
Of muche &slong;o&rrot;uwe he miȝhte telle
In þat &slong;cho&rrot;te &slong;tounde·
¶Hu&ydot; heuen heo&rrot;e hondene heom aboue·
And þonkeden Ih&combcurl;m Ihesum
Marie &slong;one·
þat heom ȝaf &slong;wuch re&slong;te·
Ake ȝwane it comez to þe monenmo&rrot;uwe Monenmoruwe ·
þanne awakez heo&rrot;e &slong;o&rrot;uwe·
And þat is al þat wur&slong;te·
Powel gan Miȝhel fo&rrot;to fra&ydot;ne·
þat he scholde don him to &slong;eine·
Ȝif he euere wu&slong;te·
 & þat he him &slong;cholde &slong;one telle·
Hou fale pe&ydot;ne&slong; weren in helle·
þat he þar of ne mi&slong;te·
¶þo seide Miȝhel to him ful sone
I ne ne
ma&ydot; nouȝt do þi bone·
þe &slong;oþe fo&rrot;to &slong;eiȝe·
Pine&slong; þare beth &slong;wiþe &slong;trongue·
La&slong;&slong;e and mo&rrot;e þat la&slong;tez longue·
To heo heom þat þare beoz ne&ydot;ȝe·
¶Ake þei a þou&slong;end tounguen were echdel·
I maked of Ire ire and of &slong;tiel·
And couþe &slong;peken and &slong;pelle·
And hadden i&slong;ete in &slong;tudijngue·
Fram þe wo&rrot;lde&slong; bigu&ydot;nnigue·
þe pe&ydot;ne&slong; ne miȝhten hu&ydot; telle·
¶Ake Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist þat alle þing wo&slong;t·
Fader and &slong;one and holi go&slong;t·
þou ȝif us miȝhte and &slong;pace·
A dome&slong;da&ydot; þane þe dom &slong;chal be·
þat we moten þine face i&slong;eo·
Lou&combtildevert;d Louerd þo&rrot;uȝh þine holie g&rabar;ce grace ·
